page.title: 14Old Peoples'Recollections
page.content:
"It was a little village with only a small population,now its a few thousand"
"Penketh Tannery was in its heyday then,its finished now.Penketh leather has gone as well.Over near the White Cottages,that used to be called cobblers' square".
"You could stand on the corner of Ditchfield Road and see the ships going by on the Manchester Ship Canal,which you do not see now bcause there are houses in the way".
"Top of the road where the new Red Lion is there was an old one,people named Stafford lived in a farm at the back,opposite the Wesleyan School".
